itemDescription: Bishop of Cloyne; Royal Astronomer of Ireland; Irish Anglican bishop and astronomer

wikipedia_page.main: John Mortimer Brinkley (born 1763 or 1766 – died 14 September 1835) was the first Royal Astronomer of Ireland and later Bishop of Cloyne. He was President of the Royal Irish Academy (1822–35), President of the Royal Astronomical Society (1831–33). He was awarded the Cunningham Medal in 1818, and the Copley Medal in 1824.
